When pollen from vanilla bees falls on crops it can trigger a bone meal effect.
Bees that have gathered nectar will drip pollen as they travel back to their hive.
chroma.ponder.nori_sheet_press.growing_s: Seaweed can be made into Nori sheets. It can be found in the ocean, growing like kelp.
chroma.ponder.cobbleworks.random_cobbleg: Random Generation - for when you don't have what you need!
chroma.ponder.laser_drill.fluid_drill.te: They serve as the "focus" for the Fluid Laser.
In addition to increasing your odds with the Ore Laser, Lenses serve another important purpose:
For example, if you place it in any Nether biome...
Fundamentally, the Fluid Laser is quite similar to its Ore counterpart, but it requires a Lens to function, and different recipes can have special requirements you may have to watch out for.
portals.ponder.undergarden.undergarden_p: Now enter the portal - you'll find yourself less in hell, more in a damp, dark place.
Click the portal with the Catalyst, as you would light a Nether Portal
Want to search the deep dark Undergarden? Build a nether portal like structure with Stone Bricks.
chroma.ponder.mutation.entity_mutation.t: Resourceful Bee pollen can trigger mutations in blocks, fluids, and entities.
For example, the Iron Bee can mutate stone into iron ore.
Pollen can mutate things up to 2 blocks below the bee, and will pass through solid blocks to mutate things below.
The I-C-Bee can mutate Water, creating Blue Ice.
It can also mutate a block of coal into a Steel Bee Egg.
It can also mutate Blizz into Blizz Bees.
chroma.ponder.nori_sheet_press.growing_s: Just like kelp, you can farm it by breaking segment second to the bottom.
chroma.ponder.mutation.entity_mutation.t: The Blaze Bee can mutate Beepers into Ghast Bees
chroma.ponder.cobbleworks.vanilla_cobble: Cobble Generators - so simple Vanilla has one!
Let's start with a basic vanilla cobblestone generator.
We can automate this with a block breaker of some sort - let's use a Modular Router with a breaker module.
We can set the router to break any cobblestone in front of it for infinite cobblestone!
chroma.ponder.nori_sheet_press.nori_shee: Nori Sheet Press - Seaweed Plate Crafting
chroma.ponder.tag.basics.description: Learn about some basic (sometimes vanilla!) mechanics that will come in handy.
chroma.ponder.tag.tech.description: Technolgy can mold the world around you - learn to harness it today!
chroma.ponder.cobbleworks.vanilla_cobble: When flowing lava touches water, it creates cobblestone. This generator floods a stair block to protect the water source.
We should go ahead and break the cobblestone here and see what happens.
chroma.ponder.latex.processing_latex.tex: So, now that you have a bunch of Latex, the question becomes: What do you do with it?
It'll start coalescing the Latex fluid into tiny balls of rubber!
This is quite a slow process; you'll have to wait around 5 seconds for each Tiny Dry Rubber...
Once you have some Tiny Dry Rubber, you can then process it further...
To get large piles of Dry Rubber...
chroma.ponder.laser_drill.lenses.header: Using Lenses to improve your chances
Tetra Forge Hammer - Building Better Tools
portals.ponder.undergarden.undergarden_p: Undergarden's Portal - this won't take you to Narnia.
chroma.ponder.stoneworks.vanilla_stonege: Stone Generators - so simple Vanilla has one!
chroma.ponder.respawn_ender_dragon.respa: Ender Dragon Respawning - when you need to make an omlet
Bee Pollen - Practically Dripping with Function
chroma.ponder.laser_drill.ether_gas.head: Getting Ether Gas
chroma.ponder.stoneworks.random_stonegen: Don't have the stone you need? Your stone generator can produce random types of stone!
If you place a block of Diamond under the stone generation point the generator will now make random stone!
chroma.ponder.laser_drill.introduction.h: How to use the Laser Drill
chroma.ponder.cobbleworks.targeted_cobbl: Maybe you want something other than vanilla cobblestone - let's say Scoria Cobblestone. This generator won't do.
If we place a specific type of Cobblestone under the cobblestone generation point, the generator will now make that type of cobblestone!
chroma.ponder.stoneworks.vanilla_stonege: Let's start with a basic vanilla stone generator.
When flowing lava falls on flowing water, it creates stone. This generator floods a stair block to protect the water source.
We should go ahead and break the stone here and see what happens.
We can automate this with a block breaker of some sort - let's use a Modular Router with a breaker module. We'll clearly need silk touch on the breaker module.
We can set the router to break any stone in front of it for infinite stone!
chroma.ponder.stoneworks.targeted_stoneg: If we place a specific type of Stone under the stone generation point, the generator will now make that type of stone!
Maybe you want something other than vanilla stone - let's say Scoria. This generator won't do.
chroma.ponder.laser_drill.introduction.t: The Laser Drill is a mid- to late-game structure in Industrial Foregoing that lets you mine up various different resources from the void.
To construct it, you'll first need either an Ore Laser Base or a Fluid Laser Base. We'll go over the Ore Laser first.
Next, add some Laser Drills within a 2-block radius around the Base to start powering it, for example like this:
..oh, and don't forget to power them!
chroma.ponder.cobbleworks.random_cobbleg: If you place a block of Iron under the cobblestone generation point the generator will now make random cobblestone!
chroma.ponder.laser_drill.introduction.t: The more drills you add, the faster the Laser is going to be
After a while, we finally managed to get our first ore; but it's not quite the one we wanted, so let's try to change our luck!
chroma.ponder.cobbleworks.random_cobbleg: Don't have the cobblestone you need? Your cobblestone generator can produce random types of cobblestone!
chroma.ponder.laser_drill.fluid_drill.he: Using Lenses in the Fluid Laser
chroma.ponder.laser_drill.lenses.text_3: For example, if we wanted more Uranium or Emerald Ore, we could add a lime lens to the Laser...
chroma.ponder.tag.portals.description: Learn how to construct some of the key portals in Chroma Endless.
chroma.ponder.laser_drill.lenses.text_1: As you could see, the resources the Ore Laser drills up are random, so how can we make sure we actually get our precious rare ores rather than ten different kinds of copper?
chroma.ponder.laser_drill.lenses.text_2: That's what lenses are for: By adding them into the Ore Laser Base, we can skew the odds of getting ores that have a certain colour in our favour.
This is a good structure for mutating bees.
Place the bee you'd like to mutate here; today we will be sacrificing a Beeper. Since things can be mutated through solid blocks, we can use a trap door to hold the Beeper in place.
We'll just place this Blaze Bee here and let it collect some nectar from this magma cake...
chroma.ponder.nori_sheet_press.nori_shee: Nori sheets are crafted by compressing a dried seaweed block with a piston.
chroma.ponder.stoneworks.random_stonegen: Random Generation - for when you don't have what you need!
Now that the Blaze Bee has gathered nectar, it will travel over to its hive, dripping pollen as it goes.
chroma.ponder.nori_sheet_press.nori_shee: Place a piston, facing down, with a gap for your seaweed block.
Place a Block of Iron down as a base.
Activate the piston by applying a redstone signal.
Place the seaweed block to compress in the middle.
The piston will compress the seaweed block, dropping nori sheets.
When the blaze bee passes over the Beeper it will mutate into a Ghast Bee.
chroma.ponder.laser_drill.ether_gas.text: First, we have our typical Fluid Laser Drill setup, with the Laser Base containing a Purple Lens. I've also left out the energy input here because you should know that the Drills need energy by now.
chroma.ponder.nori_sheet_press.dried_sea: Now craft or pack the dried seaweed into a dried seaweed block.
Seaweed can be dried in a furnace, just like kelp.
Once you've harvested your seaweed it needs to be dried and crafted into a block.
chroma.ponder.respawn_ender_dragon.respa: But now you need to summon it again - maybe you need another dragon egg or head.
Place End Crystals on the four sides of the portal frame, like this.
Placing the last one will shut off the End Portal, and resummon the Ender Dragon.
So, you've killed the Ender Dragon and activated the end portal - congrats!
chroma.ponder.tag.magic.description: Magic is just technology we don't understand yet.
It can also be crafted, and is compatible with the normal Tetra Workbench.
chroma.ponder.latex.extracting_fluids.te: Latex is a renewable resource gathered from trees, and plays a vital role in Industrial Foregoing.
To get started, you need to place a Fluid Extractor against a log of wood, such as Acacia.
To make better tools, you need the Forge Hammer multiblock.
chroma.ponder.latex.extracting_fluids.te: Keep in mind that using different logs with the Fluid Extractor may give you different fluids!
chroma.ponder.latex.processing_latex.hea: Processing Latex into Rubber and Plastic
chroma.ponder.latex.extracting_fluids.te: Be sure to check JEI for more information on what kinds of fluids you can extract at what rate from different blocks!
The Forge Hammer can be found in Tetra structures, found underground in cold biomes.
Using the Forge Hammer will drain charge from the Magmatic Cells, which will need to be replaced when depleted.
Install upgrades for the forge hammer (such as the combustion chamber) on both sides of the Forge Hammer.
Install Thermal Cells on both sides of the Forge Hammer.
